Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ this desire is associated with one's heart (לֵב) or throat (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil
= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality
= action by which humans separate themselves from a larger group of people

Node.gloss: to break out in anger|to get enraged
Node.definition: = meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which humans suddenly become very angry and get engaged in a conflict
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= set of particles marking an object or event as opposed to other objects and events
= causative action by which a deity or human being causes certain information to become available to someone else
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition
= state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which water flows in a rapid and plentiful stream
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

Node.gloss: to respect|to look upon or treat with favor|to honor
Node.definition: literally: to lift up (someone's) face; hence: = action by which humans or deities show favor or respect to someone, ◄ as if by allowing someone who is looking down out of shame or humility to look up directly into one's face
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
literally: to turn (someone) away; hence: = action by which humans or deities show their unwillingness to help (other) humans
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= action by which humans beat up other humans during a conflict
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= state in which humans are in serious trouble, ◄ caused by a loss of status, health, wealth or a combination thereof
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= action by which humans speak with anger and resentment

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to fall down|to sink down|to descend
Node.definition: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
literally: room; hence: = a restricted area within a larger unit; ◄ part of the human body
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= fellow member of the same group of people, not necessarily relatives, sharing a bond of affection, employment, or a common purpose
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= person engaged in a certain activity
= relatively high structure made of stone; ► used for guarding the surrounding area and/or for providing protection against hostile forces from outside; ≈ associated with security and protection
= state in which an object is able to withstand force
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which an object is able to withstand force

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
= a process by which the human mind forms ideas or mental images

Node.gloss: to be high of heart > to have an elevated mind
Node.definition: literally: (one's) heart is high; hence: = state in which humans have positive thoughts about themselves and their abilities, ≈ which can be either good or bad, depending on whether these thoughts are justified
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

Node.gloss: to respond|to bring back word|to report
Node.definition: literally: to bring back word; hence: = action by which humans respond to (other) humans or deities in a direct conversation
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper
= state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
literally: to contain; hence: = state in which humans are able to handle or deal with a situation
= state in which humans lack physical strength, ◄ caused by sickness or injury
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
literally: a broken spirit; hence: = a state in which someone's inner person has been deeply affected by grief, the impact of which is compared an object that has been crushed into small pieces

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
literally: to hold, carry; hence: = process by which humans undergo certain processes or actions initiated by (other) humans or deities
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
literally: to acquire; hence: = action by which humans acquire a certain quality
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= object given to someone else
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
literally: to enlarge (for someone); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities grant relief to (other) humans by alleviating difficult circumstances
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance

Node.gloss: to look for|to try out|to test|to search out|to explore|to investigate|to examine|to cross examine|to sound out|to determine
Node.definition: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons
= the process of arriving at a decision based on casting the lot
= a relationship linking two or more individuals or groups
= state in which humans or deities have physical, political, or military strength
= causative action by which humans or deities separate one or more (other) humans or animals from a larger group
= close relative, such as one's uncle's son and one's brother's son, or someone else regarded as closely related
= action by which a person or group challenges or defies an authority or agreement

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which an object is able to withstand force
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons
a long rigid piece of wood, metal, or similar material, attached in horizontal position to a gate so that it cannot be opened from the outside
= building or part of a building that has been fortified to provide additional security; often connected to the palace
= the resulting effect of one's act or speech or decision
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled
= process by which humans or animals stop living

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

Node.gloss: to eat the fruits > to bear the consequences
Node.definition: literally: to eat the fruits (of something); hence: = action by which someone accepts the consequences of an attitude or way of life ◄ as if they were the fruits of a tree; ≈ this expression can have both a positive or a negative sense
= the resulting effect of one's act or speech or decision
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= to attain a particular state or position
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= to try to win a favorable attitude from someone else; ◄ by approaching that person in a very humble way

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state of being needy as a result of one's lack of monetary or physical resources, usually resulting in a lower social status with little authority or power and at the risk of being exploited
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= state in which words are spoken without a hint of friendliness or compassion
= state in which an object or event is present or possible
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
exact meaning unknown; possibly: = process by which humans come to face difficult circumstances
= person to which one directs one's feelings of affection
= state in which someone is closely involved with another person or deity, out of affection and/or solidarity
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not
